snippet: In an effort to improve revenue, courts are turning to businesses that specialize in collections, resulting in costs that can reach thousands of dollars for a minor traffic offense.
abstract: Growing numbers of poor people across the country are ending up jailed and in debt for minor infractions in cases in which towns hire for-profit businesses to collect fines and penalties for minor infractions like traffic offenses; people who may have a fine of a few hundred dollars end up owing thousands when additional fees are added; with so many towns economically strapped, there is growing pressure on courts to bring in money by imposing fines and then agencies to collect them.
lead_paragraph: In an effort to improve revenue, courts are turning to businesses that specialize in collections, resulting in costs that can reach thousands of dollars for a minor traffic offense.

headline.seo: Probation Fees Multiply as Companies Profit
headline.main: Poor Land in Jail as Companies Add Huge Fees for Probation
headline.print_headline: Poor Land in Jail as Companies Add Huge Fees for Probation
